intro: Calonyction macranthum, commonly known as the giant lily, is a striking herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its large, showy white or pink flowers that can reach up to 12 inches in diameter. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often tinged with red or purple at the base. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Calonyction macranthum is an important species for pollinators and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
